body:
@tombergan 
> So far, in this thread, the context package move is the only example I've seen of a real, concrete, and significant problem that aliases would solve.
>
> Technically, we don't need language-level (identifier-granularity) aliasing to solve this problem, we only need package-level aliasing.

See also the [protobuf example I mentioned earlier](https://github.com/golang/go/issues/16339#issuecomment-234578142), and the more general issue of supporting the `import public` protobuf feature properly in generated code (which @griesemer [mentioned above](https://github.com/golang/go/issues/16339#issuecomment-233014582)).

Package-level aliases wouldn't address problems of that form, in which identifiers are being split out or merged in to existing packages with their own contents that must be preserved.
